Posts.Content: Oct 30, 2017 12:42PM Cleo77 wrote: Hello! I have a palpable lump that the 3D did not see and they cannot get a clear picture on u/s. My doctor can see a shape of something that is concerning so I had an MRI on Friday. That said, this is the first time an u/s has not been able to tell exactly what it is. I really think it just goes to show that sometimes you will need those extra tests and sometimes you will be fine. Best Best of luck, I know it can be scary! Cleo
Posts.Title: Anyone know what accuracy for 3D plus u/s? andia HoneyBadger47

Posts.Content: Oct 30, 2017 03:15PM Cleo77 wrote: @djmammo I will be happy to. Having been through this many times over the years, this is the first time a definitive was not given to me at an U/S appointment and my doctor , who is a breast specialist, seemed to think a biopsy would happen at that appointment. To be honest, I felt incredibly dismissed by the radiologist. And what she told me was not exactly what she told my doctor. Anyway, from I saw on the u/s with my doctor was a odd shaped shadow of something. I am hoping the MRI will give a clear picture of what is there or where they will need to biopsy, as my doctor has already told me will probably want one. Sorry that was a lot. I am just really stressed and now i have a sick kiddo at home. Just a lot going on. :)

Posts.Content: Nov 1, 2017 09:11AM Cleo77 wrote: Just got the report. "Extremely dense of breast with moderate background parenchymal enhancement which lowers the sensitivity of the examination. " Recommendation- further evaluation of the enlarging palpable area with surgical consult for consideration of biopsy.
Posts.Title: Update about MRI Cleo77 Cleo77

Posts.Content: Cleo77 wrote: Everything came back fine, just dense breast tissue. My doctor said since I had noticed it growing, I can still go ahead with a biopsy or just wait three months and have a follow up then to see if things still look the same I guess. Oh and I learned my doctor is leaving the practice. So, I don't know. I am thinking I will wait. I have never had breast dense tissue present itself so obviously before or get bigger, but her feels good with what she sees. I do have a rec for a great breast specialist in my area and since my doc is leaving, I think I will give them a shot to handle my care in the future. :) Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Update about MRI Cleo77 Cleo77

Posts.Content: Cleo77 wrote: I am frustrated. When I saw my breast specialist doctor last week, she checked on her computer if my insurance will cover an MRI given how dense my breasts are and family history of breast cancer and she was happy to see that they will. Great. I had an u/s on Monday and they still cannot see the lump clearly so her recommendation is an MRI. As luck would have it, I was on Day 5 of my cycle, so we scheduled the MRI for tomorrow. I got a call today saying my insurance has not given approval yet. If you have experienced this, is it worth calling them to see what the hold up is about? My husband was approved right away for an MRI on his knee. I don't want this put off and I really do not want to wait another cycle. I get the sense that my doctor wants things to move quickly too. Just a bundle of nerves and frustrated. Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Possible holdup with MRI tomorrow (insurance) Cleo77 Cleo77

Posts.Content: Oct 26, 2017 09:37PM Cleo77 wrote: Thank you :) My frustration over my mammogram missing things in July, even though the lump was already there, and the u/s not giving a clear picture as to what it is... my nerves are all over the place. I will call tomorrow morning to see what the hold up is when both the radiologist and my doctor are giving this order. Keeping fingers crossed that they will come through. :)

Posts.Content: Nov 16, 2017 09:23PM Cleo77 wrote: I Would get another doctor to look at you. I have had several mammograms before turning 40. In my experience, they would do a diagnostic followed with u/s. If you are concerned with your treatment and do not feel reassured, then look to see someone else for a second opinion. I am sorry, I know it can be scary. :(
